title: [BUG] Errors when using the recursive strategy in make_reduction when forecasting panel data
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
--> I experience errors when using panel data and the recursive strategy in make_reduction. I would like to use scikit-learn regressors to perform global forecasting on panel data but the predict method is giving me errors that I do not know how to solve.

Side note: in the reproducible code I set the multiindex to integer values because otherwise this also produces an error.

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
<
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sktime.utils._testing.hierarchical import _bottom_hier_datagen
from sktime.forecasting.compose import make_reduction
from sktime.forecasting.model_selection import temporal_train_test_split
from sktime.forecasting.base import ForecastingHorizon
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sktime.datatypes import check_raise

y = _bottom_hier_datagen(no_levels=1)
check_raise(y, mtype="pd-multiindex", scitype="Panel")

date_length = y.index.get_level_values(1).shape[0]
level_length = y.index.get_level_values(0).shape[0]
y = y.set_index(y.index.set_levels(np.arange(date_length), level=1))
y = y.set_index(y.index.set_levels(np.arange(level_length), level=0))

y_train, y_test = temporal_train_test_split(y, test_size=5)

forecaster = make_reduction(LinearRegression(), strategy='recursive')
horizon = pd.unique(y_test.index.get_level_values(1))
fh = ForecastingHorizon(horizon, is_relative=False)
forecaster.fit(y_train, fh=fh)
y_pred = forecaster.predict()
>
```

Error message preview:

TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
c:\Users\WREGTE16\Documents\GitHub\nl_sales_forecast\testing\a.ipynb Cell 1 in <cell line: 24>()
     [22](vscode-notebook-cell:/c%3A/Users/WREGTE16/Documents/GitHub/nl_sales_forecast/testing/a.ipynb#W0sZmlsZQ%3D%3D?line=21) fh = ForecastingHorizon(horizon, is_relative=False)
     [23](vscode-notebook-cell:/c%3A/Users/WREGTE16/Documents/GitHub/nl_sales_forecast/testing/a.ipynb#W0sZmlsZQ%3D%3D?line=22) forecaster.fit(y_train, fh=fh)
---> [24](vscode-notebook-cell:/c%3A/Users/WREGTE16/Documents/GitHub/nl_sales_forecast/testing/a.ipynb#W0sZmlsZQ%3D%3D?line=23) y_pred = forecaster.predict()

File c:\Users\WREGTE16\Miniconda3\envs\forecasting\lib\site-packages\sktime\forecasting\base\_base.py:331, in BaseForecaster.predict(self, fh, X)
    328     y_pred = self._vectorize("predict", X=X_inner, fh=fh)
    330 # convert to output mtype, identical with last y mtype seen
--> 331 y_out = convert_to(
    332     y_pred,
    333     self._y_mtype_last_seen,
    334     store=self._converter_store_y,
    335     store_behaviour="freeze",
    336 )
    338 return y_out

File c:\Users\WREGTE16\Miniconda3\envs\forecasting\lib\site-packages\sktime\datatypes\_convert.py:241, in convert_to(obj, to_type, as_scitype, store, store_behaviour)
    238     as_scitype = mtype_to_scitype(to_type)
    240 # now further narrow down as_scitype by inference from the obj
--> 241 from_type = infer_mtype(obj=obj, as_scitype=as_scitype)
    242 as_scitype = mtype_to_scitype(from_type)
    244 # if to_type is a list, we do the following:
    245 # if on the list, then don't do a conversion (convert to from_type)
...
df-list: obj must be list of pd.DataFrame, found <class 'pandas.core.series.Series'>
numpy3D: obj must be a numpy.ndarray, found <class 'pandas.core.series.Series'>
pd-multiindex: obj must be a pd.DataFrame, found <class 'pandas.core.series.Series'>
nested_univ: obj must be a pd.DataFrame, found <class 'pandas.core.series.Series'>

**Expected behavior**
<!--
-->

I would expect this code to perform a global forecast over all levels in the panel dataset, as the make_reduction strategy is set to 'recursive' which has 'pd-multiindex' as y_inner_mtype.

**Additional context**
<!--
-->

**Versions**
<details>

<!--
Please run the following code snippet and paste the output here:
 
from sktime import show_versions; show_versions()
-->
